Subjects: England, counties of, characteristics; mnemonics; utilitarian instructions
_description: Characteristics of the counties of England — 21 couplets

BodRawShires.First Lines:
The propyrte of euery shyreI shal you telle and ye will
                    here…
BodRawShires.Last Lines:
…That Lord that for us all dyde dyeSaue all these shires amen
                    say we
BodRawShires.Note:
48 lines, in couplets; after is written, ‘Probata sunt ista
                        omnia’.
BodRawShires.Editions:
Hearne,  Thomas. 
             The Itinerary of John Leland the Antiquary.
         Oxford: at the Theatre, 1710, 1769, 1770: 3rd ed. (1770), 5.xxix-xxx.
Wright,  Thomas,  and  James Orchard Halliwell-Phillipps, eds.  
             Reliquiae Antiquae.
         2 vols. London: Smith, 1845: 2.41-2.

BLHar7371.Last Lines: …Cornewall full of tymeWales full of gentlemen

Wright,  Thomas,  and  James Orchard Halliwell-Phillipps, eds.  
             Reliquiae Antiquae.
